metadata.title: CVE-2023-52566 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nilfs2:fix potential use after free in nilfs_gccache_submit_read_data() Innilfs_gccache_submit_read_data(), brelse(bh) is called to drop thereference count of bh when the call to nilfs_dat_translate() fails. If thereference count hits 0 and its owner page gets unlocked, bh may be freed.However, bh->b_page is dereferenced to put the page after that, which mayresult in a use-after-free bug. This patch moves the release operationafter unlocking and putting the page. NOTE: The function in question isonly called in GC, and in combination with current userland tools, addresstranslation using DAT does not occur in that function, so the code paththat causes this issue will not be executed. However, it is possible to runthat code path by intentionally modifying the userland GC library or bycalling the GC ioctl directly. [konishi.ryusuke@gmail.com: NOTE added tothe commit log]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-254-generic - 4.4.0-254.288
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-254-generic - 4.4.0-254.288
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-254-lowlatency - 4.4.0-254.288
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-225-generic - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-225-generic - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-225-lowlatency - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1132-kvm - 4.4.0-1132.142
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1169-aws - 4.4.0-1169.184
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-aws - 4.15.0-1168.181~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1177-azure - 4.15.0-1177.192~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-gcp - 4.15.0-1162.179~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-oracle - 4.15.0-1131.142~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-254.288').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1132.142').

linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1177.192~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.179~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1131.142~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
